item.description:
A walk through the Arnold Arboretum and lunch afterwards at the Dogwood Cafe which is across from the T station.

Meet at 10:30 inside the Forest Hills subway station, in front of the donut shop. There is $4 parking (free on Sundays) and free on street parking nearby. There is another parking lot across from the T which may be free.

Visit these sites for driving directions and the Dogwoods menu:


http://www.arboretum....
http://www.arboretum....
www.dogwoodcafe.com

The Arnold Arboretum

The Arnold Arboretum is a park for both outdoor enjoyment and scientific exploration. North America's first public arboretum, it is owned by the City of Boston and leased to Harvard University for 1,000 years, beginning in 1882. The 265 acres of rolling land includes meadows, forest and ponds with 4,000 different varieties of woody plants and 14,000 trees, shrubs and vines along with world-renowned horticultural collections.
Peter's Hill, the highest point in the Necklace, provides a glorious view of the Boston skyline. The Hunnewell Center has a visitors center and bookstore.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet inside the station in front of the donut shop.
item.name: Arnold Arboretum walk
